Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Interpretation and application of section 40(1)(a) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the Act
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant admitted misrepresentation during interview, but initial claim was deemed false
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: False claim of employment as a computer programmer
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Whether misrepresentation could induce an error in administering the Act
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Initial misrepresentation remained despite later clarification
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative immigration proceeding followed by judicial review
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness of the officer's interpretation and application
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Inadmissibility for two years due to misrepresentation
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness of visa officer’s application of section 40(1)(a)
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 40(1)(a), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Timing and voluntariness of correction during interview
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant initially maintained false claim until challenged
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing of correction relative to decision-making

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in finding inadmissibility under paragraph 40(1)(a)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review based on statutory interpretation and factual analysis
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant admitted falsehood during interview but had previously asserted it
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: False assertion of work experience as a computer programmer
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Potential to induce error in administration of the Act
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Misrepresentation was adopted by applicant until challenged
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative immigration proceeding with subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness of legal interpretation and factual findings
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness and reasonableness of officer’s determination
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Paragraph 40(1)(a), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Correction made only after questioning, not proactively disclosed
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Applicant had opportunity to respond during interview
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that clarification before final decision should negate misrepresentation
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing and manner of correction of false information
